moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 e6 3. e3 d5 4. Bd3 c5 5: This is not very much played in practice. Nevertheless SF5 considers it perfectly justified.
moves.6. O-O Bb7 7. c4 Nbd7: The knight would be probably more active in c6. Nbd7 is a good move if the knight can be rerouted to b6.
moves.8. Nc3 cxd4 9. exd4: Now the position is in equilibrium. Nevertheless, black has to soon play Ne4 to avoid white's attack to get up and running. Ne4 would promise immediate equality.
moves.9... Be7 10. Bb2 a6: Ne4 would have still been the best choice. Now white can set up a well-known attacking scheme on the kingside.
moves.11. Qe2 Ng4: This unjustified move looses on the spot due to the weakness of the e-file. 11. ... 00 12. Rac1 dxc4 13. bxc4 Re8 14. Rfe1 would have been playable.
moves.12. cxd5 exd5 13. Rfe1 g6: 13. ... Kf8 14. h3 Ngf6 15. Ng5  and there is no way to avoid trading in e7 followed by Ba3+ Re1+ and check with the knight on f7.
